Key Arguments: The proposed powers are a threat to free speech and democratic society.
Existing defamation laws are sufficient to protect against reputational harm.
The government should trust the public's ability to discern misinformation and disinformation.
The government and its agencies have themselves been sources of misinformation, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The legislation exempts the government and approved news media from the standards imposed on others, which is hypocritical.
Notable Quotes: These powers are anathema to a free and democratic society and will have a demonstrably chilling effect on political and non-political discourse in this country.
In a free and democratic society one is either for, or against free speech.
The final tragedy is this legislation exempts GA and ‘approved’ news media from the very standards imposed on everyone else, an act of sublime hypocrisy.
